{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3328986,"name":"","username":"four","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/four/{size}/199902_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-10T12:45:37.624Z","cooked":"

We had been having some issues with the amount of friction between NOTES and polycarbonate plates, therefore, we tested this as well as some of the suggested solutions.

Tested Surfaces

  • Normal Polycarbonate Surface
  • Sanded Polycarbonate (suggested by @kule28 and @Emerson1706)
  • UHMW Film (suggested by @WBCSaint)
  • Damaged and Undamaged NOTES
Testing Methodology

A NOTE was placed atop a piece of polycarbonate on a flat surface. One end of the polycarbonate was raised with the other end resting on the flat surface. The height of the raised end of the polycarbonate was measured at the moment that the NOTE began to slide.

Results

The height reached when the NOTE moved:

Height1653×992 63.1 KB

Calculated CoF:

CoF1652×993 57.4 KB
